definition: Duke Huan of Qi (reigned 685-643 BC), one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸

surname Huan

sentences.english: Hero of the story is the Duke Guan.
sentences.chinese: 故事的主人公是齐桓公管仲。

sentences.english: In the Spring and Autumn Period, Duke Huan of Qi led an army to attack a small state in the north.
sentences.chinese: 春秋时代，齐桓公出征攻打北方一个小国。

the Five Hegemons of the Spring and Autumn period (770-476 BC), namely: Duke Huan of Qi 齊桓公|齐桓公[Qi2 Huan2 gong1], Duke Wen of Jin 晉文公|晋文公[Jin4 Wen2 gong1], King Zhuang of Chu 楚莊王|楚庄王[Chu3 Zhuang1 wang2], and alternatively Duke Xiang of Song 宋襄公[Song4 Xiang1 gong1] and Duke Mu of Qin 秦穆公[Qin2 Mu4 gong1] or King Helu of Wu 吳王闔閭|吴王阖闾[Wu2 wang2 He2 Lu:2] and King Gou Jian of Yue 越王勾踐|越王勾践[Yue4 wang2 Gou1 Jian4]
Lu, vassal state at the time of the Zhou Dynasty 周朝|周朝[Zhou1 chao2], located in the southwest of present-day Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1], birthplace of Confucius
